intro: Rytidostylis glabra, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Its slender, grass-like leaves are arranged in a triangular cross-section, a characteristic feature of many sedges. Rytidostylis glabra produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Cyperaceae family.
